attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
A HTTP body.

Depending of current editor selection the type can vary.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: The currently rendered editor.

attributes.name: compatibility
attributes.description: Enables compatibility with Anypoint styling

attributes.name: outlined
attributes.description: Enables Material Design outlined style

attributes.name: readOnly
attributes.description: When set the editor is in read only mode.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: When set all controls are disabled in the form

attributes.name: autoEncode
attributes.description:
When set it automatically encodes and decodes values
in www-url-form-encoded editor.

attributes.name: contentType
attributes.description:
The current request content type. It is passed to the `raw` editor
to detect current language.

attributes.name: editorType
attributes.description:
The "raw" editor type. Acceptable values are `CodeMirror` and `Monaco`.
The setter ignores other values.

Note, both editors requires additional dependencies that needs to be loaded
outside the components. See the demo page sources for an example.

properties.name: value
properties.description:
A HTTP body.

Depending of current editor selection the type can vary.

properties.name: model
properties.description:
Previously generated by this editor metadata model.
Used internally to set the UI.

events.name: change
events.description: When the value and the model change

events.name: resize
events.description: Dispatched when the element should re-layout itself.

properties.name: model
properties.description:
Computed data model for the view.
Don't set both `value` and `model`. If the model exists then
set only it or otherwise the `value` setter override the model.

tags.name: body-multipart-editor
tags.description:
Multipart payload editor for ARC/API Console body editor.

On supported browsers (full support for FormData, Iterator and ArrayBuffer) it will render a
UI controls to generate payload message preview.

It produces a FormData object that can be used in XHR / Fetch or transformed to ArrayBuffer to be
used in socket connection.
